revised_title: A New Exceptionally Preserved Silurian Biota from Wisconsin: Implications for Silurian Ecology and Evolution
tldr: The article describes the discovery of a new exceptionally preserved biota from the Lower Silurian of Wisconsin, which fills a gap between well-known Cambrian and Devonian Konservat Lagerstatten. The biota includes diverse arthropods, annelids, and other organisms previously unrecorded from Silurian rocks. This discovery provides important information on the biology, evolution, and ecology of several taxa and contributes to our understanding of the true diversity of Silurian biotas and the factors that control their exceptional preservation.
